intro: Cyrtandra dytike, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountainous regions. Cyrtandra dytike has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat and is a subject of interest for botanists studying Hawaiian flora.
